FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART I, LINE 6B NO TAX EXEMPT BONDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 6B NO TAX EXEMPT BONDS
Person(s) Involved: John Broderick, President & Dean
Explanation of Involvement: John Broderick, President & Dean of UNH School of Law will become an employee of the University System of New Hampshire effective as of January 1, 2014.
The Organization sold investments during the tax year to pay off the remaining balance of its tax exempt bond liabilities. All tax exempt bonds were paid off at year end.
All remaining liabilities were assumed by the University System of New Hampshire along with all the assets transferred.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Part I & 2, Line 2e - Name and Explanation for Involvement in Successor
ExplntnTxt: All officers and directors of the Michigan Theological Seminary are also officers and directors of the Moody Bible Institute. As a result of the merger, these individuals will continue their role with the Institute.All employees of Michigan Theological Seminary became employees of the Moody Bible Institute.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Sch N, Part III, Additional Information
ExplntnTxt: Michigan Theological Seminary has been a subsidiary of The Moody Bible Institute of Chicago since 1/1/10. This year on 1/30/14 we fully merged them into MBI and received a letter of the merger from the State of Michigan. In following years information for this school will be included on Moody Bible's 990.
